body_html: I was able to reproduce multiprocessing error consistently by changing time.sleep to 0.01 here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_multiprocessing.py#L288, with the command python test_multiprocessing.py -v TestMultiprocessing. However if you run test_fs in isolation using python test_multiprocessing.py -v TestMultiprocessing.test_fs, it doesn't reproduce. So it tells me that, something has to do with how time.sleep is used in the sequence of tests in that module?

So it tells me that, something has to do with how time.sleep is used in the sequence of tests in that module?
body: I was able to reproduce multiprocessing error consistently by changing `time.sleep` to `0.01` here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/test/test_multiprocessing.py#L288, with the command `python test_multiprocessing.py -v TestMultiprocessing`. However if you run `test_fs` in isolation using `python test_multiprocessing.py -v TestMultiprocessing.test_fs`, it doesn't reproduce. So it tells me that, something has to do with how `time.sleep` is used in the sequence of tests in that module?
